page.title: 02VALE FARM, WHITEGATE
page.content: The owner of Vale Farm has lived there for 33 years, the farmland covers 55 acres of which 26 are hay. The owner is a cattle farmer and has 30 steers. The maximum number of cattle which can be accommodated is 50. The owner sells the beef and grows her own hay for cattle feed. There are various breeds of cattle, including Lincoln, Hereford, Blue Grey, Friesians, Jerseys, Black Crossed with Simenal, Ayrshire, Charolais and Welsh. The Farmer is keen to preserve wildlife. In her pond live Carp. She also grows the necessary plants to attract dragonflies and butterflies. Swallows, swifts, house martins, wagtails, bullfinches and goldfinches are attracted to the farm. Foxes, owls, woodpeckers, stoats, weasels, badgers, rabbits and squirrels nestle in the trees and fields.
